intro: Alchornea trewioides, commonly known as the African glorybower, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 2–5 meters. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a rough texture and a distinctive yellowish-green color. Its showy, clustered inflorescences consist of small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Alchornea trewioides is often used in traditional medicine and is also cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance.
